text.p: The following stories were reported in Lithuanian newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Eight-year-old Lukas Dainys returned to Lithuania from New York on Saturday after witnessesing the murder of his parents, who were shot dead the previous Saturday.

- The Economy Ministry has warned three hospitals and three high schools which owe a total of two million litas in energy bills that their energy supply will be cut if their debts are not paid in a week.

- President Algirdas Brazauskas on Saturday awarded the President of the International Olympic Committee Juan Antonion Samaranch with one of the country's highest honours, the order of the Grand Duke Gediminas in the first degree.
- Lithuanian companies will have to pay 17.6 percent more for the services of foreign consultants starting April 1.

- The meeting of the Baltic Assembley which started at the end of last week said that the three Baltic countries should co-ordinate their efforts to stem the flow of illgeal immigrants through the region.
- The unemployment rate in the country fell slightly in March to 6.2 percent versus 6.3 percent the previous month.

- The five biggest companies in the country according to market capitalisation on March 27 were Lithuanian Energy (886 million litas), Lithuanian Gas (767.7 million litas), Mazeikiu Nafta (697.5 million litas), Vilniaus Bank (464.6 million litas) and Klaipeda Sea Shipping company (419.5 million litas).
- The statistics department said that the richest people of the country were spending on average 764.2 litas per month, 246.9 litas of it for food.

- Lithuania's internal and foreign debt on January 1 1997 was 7.3 billion litas. Internal debt was 2.5 billion litas and the debt in foreign currency was 4.8 billion litas. The lion's share of foreign debt, 30.16 percent, was owed to the International Monetary Fund.
- The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development expressed its wish to participate in the privatisation of Lithuanian Telecomm last week.
- Kalnapilis brewery and Finnish malt producer Oy Lahden Poltimo Ab signed an agreement to form a joint venture to produce malt in Lithuania.
- The state energy prices' comission has proposed that electric energy prices be hiked by 4.6 percent and heating prices by 15 to 19 percent from May 1.
